meanings.definition: Close (a window or door) with shutters.
meanings.sent1: She shuttered the windows before the storm.
meanings.sent2: He always shuttered the house at night for security.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat shuttered the door to trap the dog inside.
meanings.sent4: The old house shuttered its windows, hiding its secrets from the world.
meanings.sent5: The photographer shuttered the lens, capturing the perfect shot.

meanings.sent1: The shop owner shuttered his store after many years of business.
meanings.sent2: The factory shuttered its doors, leaving many employees without jobs.
meanings.sent3: The bakery shuttered its windows, causing a sudden shortage of pastries in town.
meanings.sent4: The theater shuttered its stage, ending an era of captivating performances.
meanings.sent5: The school shuttered its classrooms, marking the end of an educational era.
